Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2010 10:42PM quapamom wrote: I want to second the previous poster.  Call and get it checked out as soon as you can.  There is no sense in worrying about what could be nothing for that long.  It will be worth it for the peace of mind.  Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Possible Lump and Pain peacemedic quapamom

Posts.Content: quapamom wrote: Well, I had my excisional biopsy/lumpectomy today.  I found my lump at the end of January and went through a baseline mammogram, diagnostic mammogram, ultrasound, ultrasound guided core needle biopsy and finally this.  Pathology from the core needle biopsy showed fibroadenoma and phyllodes tumor.  Excision was recommended to rule confirm diagnosis.  I have to say that the surgery today was a piece of cake compared to my core needle biopsy.  They did the surgery at a surgery center under general anesthesia.  I got all prepped with special stockings and compression things on my calves, IV started, vitals checked.  Met with anesthesiologist and surgeon.  My surgeon said a prayer with me before he went to get ready.  I was given demerol to "help me relax" and next thing I knew I woke up in recovery.  They got me a Diet Coke when I was alert.  I got dressed and they called my mom to come get me.  My mom and girls only were gone for about 2 hours, enough time for IHOP and Walmart.  My girls were only upset that they didn't get to come back to the waiting area to get the candy from the vending machine they had scoped out earlier.  I was wheeled out to my waiting car.   No major pain. Mostly a dull ache.  I do have a headache which may be from the general.  I'm taking the pain meds as prescribed.  Been taking one pill, but just took two to try and sleep well tonight and hold off this headache.  I slept most of the day, on and off.  No nausea from the general, but they gave me something to help prevent that.   Funny things I have noticed since coming home:  I brought home my hair net tucked in the back of my bra.  I still had the stickers on my back that they used for the ekg.  (I wondered what my hair kept sticking on.)  My 8 year old daughter says I smell like a hospital.  I think I stink from the betadine?  I can't take a shower till tomorrow with a waterproof dressing.  I'm thinking I'll have to use first aid tape and a plastic bag to make that work.  I can't remove the bandage for 5-6 days.   I just thought I'd post my experience for anyone else going through this.  Now I wait for results.  Hopefully Wednesday will come quickly!   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2010 09:58PM quapamom wrote: Lisa and Sheila, thank you for your replies.  I'm doing just tylenol now, 48 hours later.  I'm feeling much better.  The anesthesia hangover is gone.  I still have really low energy.  I'm wanting to do "normal" things, but my body is telling me, not yet.  Climbing stairs makes me winded.  Pain is quite manageable.  I'm still sleeping in my sports bra.  Mostly that is because I don't want to rub the dressing off prematurely while I sleep.  Three more days and I can find out what is under that bandage.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2010 04:02AM quapamom wrote: At my post-op appointment, I questioned my surgeon about my results being so different from the initial core needle biopsy results.  I raised enough questions to prompt him to call the pathologist.  Long story short, the sample was sent to another lab for a second opinion.  My surgeon called me this afternoon(2 weeks later) with the B9 results.  Turns out it was a benign fibroadenoma AND a bonus intraductal papilloma.  Some was in the margin, so it didn't all get removed.  The needle biopsy only grabbed the fibroadenoma, which is why the papilloma was not noticed at the time.  So, I'm happy about the B9 results, not crazy about the margins not being clear, and definitely following up with an ultrasound in 6 months.  Done for now...I guess.  I still have swelling at the site now one month post-op. I'm afraid that I will be manic about SBE's in the next six months espcially as the swelling goes down.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2010 03:17AM quapamom wrote: Thinking of you, kickon2it, as you have your surgery tomorrow.  Praying for B9 results!
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2010 04:28PM quapamom wrote: I called the doc's office and got my results.  Doc is on vacation, but nurse said report shows no signs of atypia.  There is a papilloma of the intraductal area.  I'm totally confused now.  I thought we were confirming the core needle biopsy's diagnosis of fibroadenoma or phyllodes tumor.  Now I have something else to research.  How could the results from the two biopsies come back with completely different results?  I'm relieved on one hand, but now doubting that he hit the right spot in the surgery.  Could he have missed it and found something else? Or am I being totally neurotic?  I asked for a copy of the report and she said not until the doc has signed off on it.  Waaah!  I'm worried she didn't tell me everything.  My followup isn't until the 30th.  Ugh!
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2010 05:02PM quapamom wrote: Thanks for checking in.  I'm glad everything went well.  Sorry about the nausea.  The one previous time I had general anesthesia I had severe nausea/vomiting.  So this time around I let the anesthesiologist know and he added an anti-nausea cocktail to my iv.  No issues this time.  Everyone reacts differently to anesthesia too.  He told me that I may have no issues with a short duration being under too, but gave me some good drugs anyway.  I'm sending you calming thoughts as you recover and wait for the results.  You are in my prayers!
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy Done quapamom quapamom
